text: Elderly woman with sudden onset of palpitations, shortness of breath, and chest discomfort. ECG shows atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. Diagnosis: new-onset atrial fibrillation.
label: cardiology

text: Young man with severe acne, oily skin, and multiple inflamed nodules on the face and back. No systemic symptoms. Diagnosis: nodulocystic acne vulgaris.
label: dermatology

text: Middle-aged woman with progressive fatigue, constipation, and dry skin. Physical exam reveals delayed relaxation of deep tendon reflexes. Labs show high TSH and low T4. Diagnosis: primary hypothyroidism.
label: endocrinology

text: Man with chronic heartburn, regurgitation, and difficulty swallowing solids. Upper endoscopy reveals erosive esophagitis. Diagnosis: gastroesophageal reflux disease with esophagitis.
label: gastroenterology

text: Teenager with persistent nosebleeds, easy bruising, and petechiae. Platelet count is low. Diagnosis: immune thrombocytopenic purpura.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Traveler returns from Southeast Asia with fever, severe myalgias, retro-orbital pain, and a blanching rash. Labs show leukopenia and thrombocytopenia. Diagnosis: dengue fever.
label: infectious_disease

text: Elderly man with history of diabetes presents with decreased urine output, swelling of the legs, and periorbital edema. Labs show elevated BUN and creatinine. Diagnosis: acute on chronic renal failure.
label: nephrology

text: Young woman with sudden onset of severe headache, photophobia, and neck stiffness. CSF analysis shows xanthochromia. Diagnosis: subarachnoid hemorrhage.
label: neurology

text: Pregnant woman at 28 weeks presents with painless vaginal bleeding. Ultrasound shows placenta previa. Diagnosis: placenta previa.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Man with gradual loss of central vision in both eyes. Fundoscopy reveals drusen deposits in the macula. Diagnosis: age-related macular degeneration.
label: ophthalmology

text: Young athlete with pain and swelling over the tibial tuberosity. Symptoms worsen with running and jumping. Diagnosis: Osgood-Schlatter disease.
label: orthopedics

text: Child with persistent snoring, mouth breathing, and recurrent otitis media. Exam reveals enlarged adenoids. Diagnosis: adenoid hypertrophy.
label: otolaryngology

text: Young adult with recurrent panic attacks, palpitations, sweating, and fear of dying. No medical cause found. Diagnosis: panic disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Middle-aged man with chronic cough, sputum production, and frequent respiratory infections. Chest X-ray shows increased bronchovascular markings. Diagnosis: chronic bronchitis.
label: pulmonology

text: Woman with recurrent oral ulcers, genital ulcers, and erythema nodosum. Pathergy test is positive. Diagnosis: Behçet's disease.
label: rheumatology

text: Elderly man with history of coronary artery disease presents with sudden onset of severe chest pain, diaphoresis, and shortness of breath. Troponin levels are elevated and coronary angiography reveals occlusion of the left anterior descending artery. Diagnosis: acute anterior myocardial infarction.
label: cardiology

text: Young woman with palpitations, anxiety, and weight loss. Physical exam reveals tachycardia and fine tremor. Thyroid function tests show suppressed TSH and elevated free T4. Diagnosis: hyperthyroidism due to Graves' disease.
label: endocrinology

text: Middle-aged man presents with persistent cough, hemoptysis, and unintentional weight loss. Chest CT shows a mass in the right upper lobe. Bronchoscopy confirms non-small cell lung carcinoma. Diagnosis: lung cancer.
label: pulmonology

text: Teenager with recurrent episodes of abdominal pain, diarrhea, and blood in stool. Colonoscopy reveals continuous mucosal inflammation starting from the rectum. Diagnosis: ulcerative colitis.
label: gastroenterology

text: Woman with progressive fatigue, pallor, and heavy menstrual bleeding. CBC shows microcytic anemia and low ferritin. Diagnosis: iron deficiency anemia.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Young adult with fever, headache, and photophobia. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy CSF with elevated neutrophils and low glucose. Gram stain shows Gram-negative diplococci. Diagnosis: bacterial meningitis due to Neisseria meningitidis.
label: infectious_disease

text: Elderly woman with gradual onset of confusion, lethargy, and peripheral edema. Labs show elevated creatinine, low GFR, and proteinuria. Renal ultrasound reveals small, shrunken kidneys. Diagnosis: end-stage chronic kidney disease.
label: nephrology

text: Middle-aged man with sudden onset of severe headache, vomiting, and nuchal rigidity. CT scan shows blood in the subarachnoid space. Diagnosis: subarachnoid hemorrhage due to ruptured berry aneurysm.
label: neurology

text: Pregnant woman at 36 weeks presents with severe hypertension, proteinuria, and upper abdominal pain. Labs show elevated liver enzymes and low platelets. Diagnosis: HELLP syndrome.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Young adult with sudden painless loss of vision in one eye. Fundoscopy reveals pale retina and cherry-red spot. Diagnosis: central retinal artery occlusion.
label: ophthalmology

text: Elderly man with progressive hip pain and difficulty walking. X-ray shows loss of joint space and osteophyte formation. Diagnosis: osteoarthritis of the hip.
label: orthopedics

text: Child with recurrent sore throats, snoring, and mouth breathing. Exam reveals enlarged tonsils and adenoids. Diagnosis: obstructive sleep apnea due to adenotonsillar hypertrophy.
label: otolaryngology

text: Young woman with persistent sadness, feelings of worthlessness, and suicidal ideation. Symptoms have lasted for more than 6 months and interfere with daily functioning. Diagnosis: severe major depressive disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Middle-aged man with progressive dyspnea, non-productive cough, and digital clubbing. High-resolution CT shows honeycombing and reticular opacities. Diagnosis: idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
label: pulmonology

text: Woman with recurrent oral ulcers, genital ulcers, and uveitis. Pathergy test is positive. Diagnosis: Behçet's disease.
label: rheumatology

text: Middle-aged man presents with crushing substernal chest pain radiating to the jaw, associated with diaphoresis and nausea. ECG reveals ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Diagnosis: inferior STEMI.
label: cardiology

text: Elderly woman with history of hypertension presents with sudden onset of severe tearing chest pain radiating to the back. CT angiography shows aortic dissection. Diagnosis: acute aortic dissection.
label: cardiology

text: Young adult with multiple erythematous, scaly plaques on the scalp and extensor surfaces, some with silvery scale. No joint involvement. Diagnosis: chronic plaque psoriasis.
label: dermatology

text: Teenager presents with clusters of vesicles on the lips, preceded by tingling and burning. Lesions resolve with crusting. Diagnosis: herpes labialis.
label: dermatology

text: Woman complains of progressive fatigue, cold intolerance, and constipation. Physical exam reveals dry skin and bradycardia. Labs show elevated TSH and low free T4. Diagnosis: primary hypothyroidism.
label: endocrinology

text: Young man with episodes of sweating, palpitations, and tremor. Blood glucose measured at 40 mg/dL during symptoms. Imaging reveals pancreatic mass. Diagnosis: insulinoma.
label: endocrinology

text: Middle-aged woman presents with recurrent upper abdominal pain, jaundice, and dark urine. Ultrasound shows dilated bile ducts and gallstones. Diagnosis: choledocholithiasis.
label: gastroenterology

text: Young adult with crampy abdominal pain, weight loss, and non-bloody diarrhea. Colonoscopy reveals skip lesions and cobblestoning. Diagnosis: Crohn's disease.
label: gastroenterology

text: Child presents with pallor, fatigue, and frequent infections. CBC shows pancytopenia. Bone marrow biopsy reveals blasts. Diagnosis: acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Older adult with persistent bone pain, anemia, and hypercalcemia. Serum protein electrophoresis shows M-spike. Diagnosis: multiple myeloma.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Traveler returns from Africa with high fever, chills, and jaundice. Blood smear shows ring forms in erythrocytes. Diagnosis: malaria.
label: infectious_disease

text: Child with sore throat, fever, and sandpaper-like rash on trunk and extremities. Strawberry tongue noted. Diagnosis: scarlet fever.
label: infectious_disease

text: Elderly man with long-standing hypertension presents with progressive lower extremity edema, nocturia, and frothy urine. Labs show elevated creatinine and proteinuria. Diagnosis: nephrotic syndrome.
label: nephrology

text: Young woman with sudden onset of severe flank pain, hematuria, and nausea. Non-contrast CT shows ureteral stone. Diagnosis: renal colic due to nephrolithiasis.
label: nephrology

text: Middle-aged man presents with sudden onset of right-sided weakness, facial droop, and aphasia. CT scan shows left MCA infarct. Diagnosis: acute ischemic stroke.
label: neurology

text: Young woman with progressive muscle weakness, diplopia, and ptosis worsening throughout the day. Edrophonium test is positive. Diagnosis: myasthenia gravis.
label: neurology

text: Pregnant woman at 10 weeks presents with vaginal bleeding and mild lower abdominal pain. Ultrasound shows viable intrauterine pregnancy. Diagnosis: threatened miscarriage.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Woman with severe dysmenorrhea, chronic pelvic pain, and infertility. Laparoscopy reveals endometrial implants on ovaries. Diagnosis: endometriosis.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Elderly man presents with sudden painless loss of vision in one eye. Fundoscopy reveals cherry-red spot at the fovea. Diagnosis: central retinal artery occlusion.
label: ophthalmology

text: Young adult with eye pain, photophobia, and blurred vision. Slit lamp exam shows hypopyon and ciliary flush. Diagnosis: anterior uveitis.
label: ophthalmology

text: Elderly woman falls and cannot bear weight on her right leg. X-ray shows displaced femoral neck fracture. Diagnosis: hip fracture.
label: orthopedics

text: Athlete presents with acute knee pain after pivoting injury. Exam reveals joint effusion and positive Lachman test. MRI confirms ACL tear. Diagnosis: anterior cruciate ligament rupture.
label: orthopedics

text: Child presents with sore throat, drooling, and muffled voice. Exam reveals inspiratory stridor and sitting in tripod position. Diagnosis: acute epiglottitis.
label: otolaryngology

text: Adult with recurrent episodes of nasal congestion, sneezing, and watery rhinorrhea. No fever. Diagnosis: allergic rhinitis.
label: otolaryngology

text: Young woman with persistent sadness, anhedonia, and insomnia for 2 months. No psychotic symptoms. Diagnosis: major depressive disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Man with intrusive thoughts of contamination and compulsive hand washing. Symptoms interfere with daily life. Diagnosis: obsessive-compulsive disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Middle-aged man with progressive shortness of breath, chronic productive cough, and barrel-shaped chest. Spirometry shows FEV1/FVC < 70%. Diagnosis: COPD.
label: pulmonology

text: Young adult with sudden onset of pleuritic chest pain, dyspnea, and hemoptysis. CT pulmonary angiogram shows filling defect in right pulmonary artery. Diagnosis: pulmonary embolism.
label: pulmonology

text: Woman with symmetric joint pain, morning stiffness lasting >1 hour, and swelling of MCP and PIP joints. Labs show positive rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP. Diagnosis: rheumatoid arthritis.
label: rheumatology

text: Young woman with malar rash, photosensitivity, oral ulcers, and arthritis. Labs reveal positive ANA and anti-dsDNA. Diagnosis: systemic lupus erythematosus.
label: rheumatology

text: History: 67-year-old male with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia presents to the emergency department after experiencing sudden, severe chest pain radiating to his left arm while mowing the lawn. He describes the pain as crushing and associated with diaphoresis and nausea. On arrival, he is diaphoretic and hypotensive. ECG shows ST-segment elevations in leads II, III, and aVF. Troponin is elevated. Impression: Acute inferior ST-elevation myocardial infarction. Plan: Emergent cardiac catheterization.
label: cardiology

text: History: 42-year-old woman presents with a 3-month history of progressive fatigue, cold intolerance, and weight gain. She reports constipation and hair loss. On exam, she has dry, coarse skin and delayed relaxation of deep tendon reflexes. TSH is markedly elevated, free T4 is low. Impression: Primary hypothyroidism, likely Hashimoto's thyroiditis. Plan: Start levothyroxine and monitor thyroid function tests.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 28-year-old man presents with 2 weeks of worsening abdominal pain, frequent loose bloody stools, and unintentional weight loss. He denies recent travel or antibiotic use. On exam, he is pale and tachycardic. Abdomen is tender in the left lower quadrant. Colonoscopy reveals continuous mucosal inflammation from the rectum to the sigmoid colon. Impression: New diagnosis of ulcerative colitis. Plan: Initiate mesalamine and refer to gastroenterology.
label: gastroenterology

text: History: 55-year-old woman with a history of heavy menstrual periods presents with increasing fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion. She reports pica and palpitations. Exam reveals conjunctival pallor and a systolic flow murmur. Labs: Hemoglobin 8.2 g/dL, MCV 68 fL, ferritin 6 ng/mL. Impression: Iron deficiency anemia secondary to chronic blood loss. Plan: Iron supplementation and gynecology referral.
label: hematology_oncology

text: History: 34-year-old man returns from a business trip to India with 5 days of high fever, chills, and severe headache. He also reports muscle aches and a maculopapular rash. On exam, he is febrile and has mild hepatosplenomegaly. Labs show leukopenia and thrombocytopenia. Impression: Suspected dengue fever. Plan: Supportive care and monitor for complications.
label: infectious_disease

text: History: 70-year-old man with diabetes and hypertension presents with swelling of the legs and decreased urine output over the past week. He denies dysuria or fever. Exam shows bilateral pitting edema and periorbital puffiness. Labs: Creatinine 3.2 mg/dL (baseline 1.1), BUN 48 mg/dL, urinalysis with proteinuria. Impression: Acute on chronic kidney disease. Plan: Adjust medications, nephrology consult, monitor renal function.
label: nephrology

text: History: 60-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of right-sided weakness and slurred speech. Her husband reports she was well until 30 minutes ago. On exam, she is alert but has right facial droop, right arm and leg weakness, and expressive aphasia. CT head is negative for hemorrhage. Impression: Acute ischemic stroke, likely left MCA territory. Plan: Activate stroke protocol, consider tPA.
label: neurology

text: History: 32-year-old woman, G2P1, at 36 weeks gestation, presents with severe headache, visual disturbances, and upper abdominal pain. Blood pressure is 170/110 mmHg. Exam reveals hyperreflexia and mild pedal edema. Labs: Platelets 80,000/µL, AST 120 U/L, proteinuria. Impression: HELLP syndrome. Plan: Admit for stabilization and plan for delivery.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: History: 75-year-old man presents with gradual, painless loss of vision in his right eye over several months. He denies pain or redness. Fundoscopy reveals drusen in the macula. Impression: Age-related macular degeneration. Plan: Refer to ophthalmology for further management and discuss low-vision aids.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 16-year-old male basketball player presents with anterior knee pain that worsens with activity and improves with rest. He denies trauma. Exam reveals tenderness over the tibial tuberosity and mild swelling. Impression: Osgood-Schlatter disease. Plan: Activity modification, ice, and physical therapy.
label: orthopedics

text: History: 8-year-old boy presents with 3 days of sore throat, muffled voice, and difficulty swallowing. His mother notes he is drooling and prefers to sit upright. Exam reveals inspiratory stridor and a toxic appearance. Impression: Acute epiglottitis. Plan: Secure airway, start IV antibiotics, admit to ICU.
label: otolaryngology

text: History: 24-year-old woman presents with persistent low mood, loss of interest in activities, and difficulty sleeping for the past 2 months. She reports poor appetite and feelings of worthlessness. No history of mania or psychosis. Impression: Major depressive disorder, moderate. Plan: Initiate SSRI and arrange follow-up for psychotherapy.
label: psychiatry

text: History: 58-year-old man with a 40-pack-year smoking history presents with progressive shortness of breath, chronic cough, and occasional wheezing. He reports increased sputum production and two episodes of bronchitis in the past year. Exam reveals decreased breath sounds and prolonged expiration. Spirometry: FEV1/FVC < 0.7. Impression: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Plan: Smoking cessation, inhaled bronchodilators, and vaccination.
label: pulmonology

text: History: 45-year-old woman presents with 6 months of joint pain and morning stiffness lasting over an hour. She notes swelling in her hands and wrists. Exam reveals synovitis of MCP and PIP joints bilaterally. Labs: Positive rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP antibodies. Impression: Rheumatoid arthritis. Plan: Start methotrexate and refer to rheumatology.
label: rheumatology

text: History: 54-year-old man with a history of coronary artery disease presents with chest discomfort that started while climbing stairs. He describes the pain as pressure-like, radiating to the jaw, and associated with mild shortness of breath. Symptoms resolved after 10 minutes of rest. ECG is unremarkable. Impression: Stable angina. Plan: Optimize medical therapy and schedule stress testing.
label: cardiology

text: History: 36-year-old woman presents with palpitations, heat intolerance, and unintentional weight loss over 2 months. She reports increased anxiety and tremor. Exam reveals tachycardia, fine tremor, and a diffusely enlarged, non-tender thyroid. Labs: Suppressed TSH, elevated free T4. Impression: Graves' disease. Plan: Start methimazole and beta-blocker, refer to endocrinology.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 45-year-old man presents with 4 weeks of intermittent right upper quadrant pain, especially after fatty meals. He reports nausea but no vomiting or jaundice. Exam: Mild tenderness in the right upper quadrant, no rebound. Ultrasound shows gallstones without ductal dilation. Impression: Symptomatic cholelithiasis. Plan: Elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
label: gastroenterology

text: History: 62-year-old woman presents with progressive fatigue, easy bruising, and recurrent infections over 2 months. Exam reveals pallor and scattered petechiae. CBC: Pancytopenia. Bone marrow biopsy: Hypercellular marrow with >20% blasts. Impression: Acute myeloid leukemia. Plan: Admit for induction chemotherapy and supportive care.
label: hematology_oncology

text: History: 29-year-old man presents with 5 days of fever, sore throat, and a diffuse maculopapular rash. He recently returned from Brazil. Exam: Cervical lymphadenopathy, mild hepatosplenomegaly. Labs: Mild thrombocytopenia, positive dengue NS1 antigen. Impression: Dengue fever. Plan: Supportive care, monitor for warning signs.
label: infectious_disease

text: History: 68-year-old woman with hypertension and diabetes presents with swelling of the ankles and foamy urine for 2 weeks. Exam: Bilateral pitting edema, blood pressure 150/90 mmHg. Labs: Creatinine 2.1 mg/dL, proteinuria 4g/24h. Impression: Nephrotic syndrome, likely diabetic nephropathy. Plan: ACE inhibitor, dietary sodium restriction, nephrology referral.
label: nephrology

text: History: 72-year-old man presents with sudden onset of left-sided weakness and facial droop. He was last seen normal 1 hour ago. Exam: Left hemiparesis, left facial droop, slurred speech. CT head: No hemorrhage. Impression: Acute ischemic stroke, right MCA territory. Plan: tPA eligibility assessment, admit to stroke unit.
label: neurology

text: History: 30-year-old woman, G1P0 at 38 weeks, presents with regular contractions and lower abdominal pain for 6 hours. She reports rupture of membranes 2 hours ago. Exam: Cervix 6 cm dilated, 80% effaced, vertex at -1 station. Fetal heart rate reassuring. Impression: Active labor. Plan: Admit to labor and delivery, monitor progress.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: History: 80-year-old man presents with gradual loss of peripheral vision in both eyes. He denies pain or redness. Exam: Increased cup-to-disc ratio on fundoscopy, intraocular pressure 28 mmHg. Impression: Chronic open-angle glaucoma. Plan: Start topical prostaglandin analog, refer to ophthalmology.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 22-year-old male soccer player presents with acute right ankle pain and swelling after twisting injury during a match. Exam: Tenderness over lateral malleolus, mild ecchymosis, unable to bear weight. X-ray: No fracture. Impression: Lateral ankle sprain. Plan: RICE, crutches, physical therapy.
label: orthopedics

text: History: 10-year-old girl presents with 4 days of worsening sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and muffled voice. Her mother notes she is drooling and prefers to sit upright. Exam: Inspiratory stridor, toxic appearance, high fever. Impression: Acute epiglottitis. Plan: Secure airway, IV antibiotics, ICU admission.
label: otolaryngology

text: History: 40-year-old man presents with 2 months of low mood, poor concentration, and insomnia. He reports loss of interest in hobbies and decreased appetite. No suicidal ideation. Impression: Major depressive disorder, mild. Plan: Start SSRI, recommend psychotherapy, follow up in 2 weeks.
label: psychiatry

text: History: 65-year-old woman with a 30-pack-year smoking history presents with chronic cough, progressive dyspnea, and frequent respiratory infections. Exam: Barrel chest, decreased breath sounds, prolonged expiration. Spirometry: FEV1/FVC 0.6. Impression: COPD, moderate. Plan: Smoking cessation, inhaled bronchodilators, pulmonary rehab.
label: pulmonology

text: History: 50-year-old woman presents with 8 months of joint pain, morning stiffness, and swelling in her hands and wrists. Exam: Synovitis of MCP and PIP joints, ulnar deviation. Labs: Positive anti-CCP, elevated ESR. Impression: Rheumatoid arthritis. Plan: Start DMARD, refer to rheumatology, monitor for complications.
label: rheumatology

text: History: 61-year-old man with hypertension and hyperlipidemia presents with sudden onset of severe chest pain radiating to the back. He is diaphoretic and hypotensive. CT angiography reveals a Stanford type A aortic dissection. Impression: Acute aortic dissection. Plan: Emergent cardiothoracic surgery consult, blood pressure control.
label: cardiology

text: History: 29-year-old woman presents with weight gain, fatigue, and irregular menses. Exam reveals hirsutism and acne. Labs: Elevated testosterone, LH/FSH ratio >2. Pelvic ultrasound: Bilateral enlarged ovaries with multiple cysts. Impression: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Plan: Lifestyle modification, consider oral contraceptives, metformin.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 52-year-old man presents with progressive dysphagia to solids and liquids, unintentional weight loss, and regurgitation of undigested food. Barium swallow: Bird-beak appearance of distal esophagus. Impression: Achalasia. Plan: Refer for esophageal manometry and possible pneumatic dilation.
label: gastroenterology

text: History: 47-year-old woman presents with easy bruising, recurrent nosebleeds, and heavy menstrual periods. Exam: Petechiae on lower extremities. Labs: Platelets 18,000/µL, normal WBC and hemoglobin. Impression: Immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP). Plan: Start corticosteroids, monitor platelet count.
label: hematology_oncology

text: History: 38-year-old man returns from sub-Saharan Africa with 4 days of fever, chills, and headache. Exam: Scleral icterus, mild splenomegaly. Blood smear: Ring forms in erythrocytes. Impression: Malaria. Plan: Start antimalarial therapy, monitor for complications.
label: infectious_disease

text: History: 75-year-old woman with diabetes presents with generalized edema, frothy urine, and fatigue. Exam: Periorbital and lower extremity edema. Labs: Proteinuria >3.5g/day, hypoalbuminemia, hyperlipidemia. Impression: Nephrotic syndrome, likely diabetic nephropathy. Plan: ACE inhibitor, statin, dietary counseling, nephrology follow-up.
label: nephrology

text: History: 58-year-old man presents with sudden onset of right-sided facial droop, arm weakness, and slurred speech. He was last seen normal 45 minutes ago. Exam: Right facial droop, right hemiparesis, expressive aphasia. CT head: No bleed. Impression: Acute ischemic stroke, left MCA. Plan: tPA eligibility assessment, admit to stroke unit.
label: neurology

text: History: 27-year-old woman, G2P1 at 32 weeks, presents with new-onset hypertension, proteinuria, and headache. Exam: BP 165/105 mmHg, mild pedal edema. Labs: Proteinuria, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets. Impression: Preeclampsia with severe features. Plan: Admit for monitoring, magnesium sulfate, plan for delivery.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: History: 70-year-old man presents with gradual, painless loss of central vision in both eyes. He has difficulty reading and recognizing faces. Fundoscopy: Drusen in the macula. Impression: Age-related macular degeneration. Plan: Refer to ophthalmology, discuss low-vision aids.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 19-year-old male football player presents with acute left knee pain after a tackle. Exam: Swelling, tenderness over medial joint line, positive McMurray test. MRI: Medial meniscus tear. Impression: Medial meniscus injury. Plan: Rest, physical therapy, consider arthroscopic repair if symptoms persist.
label: orthopedics

text: History: 6-year-old boy presents with 2 days of fever, sore throat, and difficulty swallowing. Exam: Muffled voice, drooling, inspiratory stridor. Impression: Acute epiglottitis. Plan: Secure airway, IV antibiotics, ICU admission.
label: otolaryngology

text: History: 35-year-old woman presents with persistent low mood, fatigue, and poor concentration for 4 months. She reports early morning awakening and weight loss. No psychosis or mania. Impression: Major depressive disorder, moderate. Plan: Start SSRI, recommend psychotherapy, monitor for suicidality.
label: psychiatry

text: History: 72-year-old man with a 50-pack-year smoking history presents with chronic cough, progressive dyspnea, and frequent exacerbations. Exam: Barrel chest, decreased breath sounds, prolonged expiration. Spirometry: FEV1/FVC 0.55. Impression: Severe COPD. Plan: Smoking cessation, triple inhaler therapy, pulmonary rehab.
label: pulmonology

text: History: 59-year-old woman presents with 1 year of joint pain, morning stiffness, and swelling in her hands and wrists. Exam: Synovitis of MCP and PIP joints, mild ulnar deviation. Labs: Positive rheumatoid factor, elevated CRP. Impression: Rheumatoid arthritis. Plan: Start methotrexate, refer to rheumatology, monitor for side effects.
label: rheumatology

text: History: 34-year-old woman presents with a rapidly spreading, painful, erythematous rash on her right lower leg. She reports fever and chills. Exam: Well-demarcated, warm, tender plaque with raised borders. Impression: Erysipelas. Plan: Start IV antibiotics, monitor for systemic symptoms.
label: dermatology

text: History: 22-year-old man presents with multiple, itchy, coin-shaped, scaly plaques on his arms and legs. He reports worsening during winter. Exam: Well-circumscribed, erythematous plaques with overlying scale. Impression: Nummular eczema. Plan: Emollients, topical corticosteroids, avoid irritants.
label: dermatology

text: History: 45-year-old woman presents with progressive darkening of the skin in her axillae and neck. She has a history of obesity and type 2 diabetes. Exam: Velvety, hyperpigmented plaques in intertriginous areas. Impression: Acanthosis nigricans. Plan: Address underlying insulin resistance, weight loss counseling.
label: dermatology

text: History: 28-year-old woman presents with fatigue, weight gain, and hair loss over 6 months. She also reports constipation and cold intolerance. Exam: Dry skin, periorbital puffiness, delayed ankle reflexes. Labs: TSH 18 mIU/L, free T4 low. Impression: Primary hypothyroidism. Plan: Start levothyroxine, monitor TSH.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 50-year-old man presents with episodes of sweating, palpitations, and headaches. Blood pressure is consistently elevated. Labs: Plasma metanephrines elevated. Impression: Pheochromocytoma. Plan: Alpha-blockade, then surgery, refer to endocrinology.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 36-year-old woman presents with irregular menses, galactorrhea, and visual disturbances. Exam: Bitemporal hemianopsia. Labs: Prolactin elevated, MRI shows pituitary macroadenoma. Impression: Prolactinoma. Plan: Start dopamine agonist, neurosurgery consult if no response.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 62-year-old man presents with sudden onset of right-sided weakness, slurred speech, and facial droop. He was last seen normal 20 minutes ago. Exam: Right hemiparesis, right facial droop, expressive aphasia. CT head: No hemorrhage. Impression: Acute ischemic stroke, left MCA. Plan: tPA eligibility assessment, admit to stroke unit.
label: neurology

text: History: 41-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of double vision, drooping eyelids, and difficulty chewing, worse in the evening. Exam: Ptosis, fatigable muscle weakness. Edrophonium test positive. Impression: Myasthenia gravis. Plan: Start pyridostigmine, refer to neurology.
label: neurology

text: History: 55-year-old man presents with progressive memory loss, difficulty managing finances, and getting lost in familiar places. Family notes personality changes. Exam: Mini-Mental State Exam 18/30. Impression: Alzheimer's disease. Plan: Start cholinesterase inhibitor, caregiver support, safety planning.
label: neurology

text: History: 60-year-old woman presents with sudden, painless loss of vision in her left eye. She describes a curtain descending over her visual field. Exam: Fundoscopy shows retinal detachment. Impression: Retinal detachment. Plan: Emergent ophthalmology referral, surgical repair.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 35-year-old man presents with severe eye pain, redness, and photophobia after working outdoors. Exam: Ciliary injection, corneal ulcer with fluorescein uptake. Impression: Infectious keratitis. Plan: Start topical antibiotics, urgent ophthalmology consult.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 72-year-old woman presents with gradual, bilateral loss of peripheral vision. She denies pain. Exam: Increased cup-to-disc ratio, intraocular pressure 30 mmHg. Impression: Chronic open-angle glaucoma. Plan: Start topical prostaglandin analog, refer to ophthalmology for ongoing care.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 19-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of multiple, painful, grouped vesicles on an erythematous base around her mouth. She reports burning and tingling prior to the eruption. Impression: Herpes simplex labialis. Plan: Start oral acyclovir, advise on triggers and recurrence.
label: dermatology

text: History: 60-year-old man presents with a non-healing ulcer on the dorsum of his right hand. He works outdoors and has a history of sun exposure. Exam: Ulcerated, indurated lesion with rolled edges. Impression: Squamous cell carcinoma. Plan: Excisional biopsy, dermatology referral.
label: dermatology

text: History: 25-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of hirsutism, deepening voice, and increased muscle mass. Exam: Temporal balding, clitoromegaly. Labs: Elevated DHEAS, testosterone. Imaging: Adrenal mass. Impression: Androgen-secreting adrenal tumor. Plan: Endocrinology referral, surgical evaluation.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 48-year-old man presents with polyuria, polydipsia, and unintentional weight loss over 3 months. Exam: Dry mucous membranes, decreased skin turgor. Labs: Fasting glucose 220 mg/dL, HbA1c 9.2%. Impression: New-onset type 2 diabetes mellitus. Plan: Start metformin, dietary counseling, monitor glucose.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 33-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of palpitations, sweating, and tremor. She reports relief after eating. Labs: Blood glucose 38 mg/dL during symptoms, insulin and C-peptide elevated. Imaging: Pancreatic mass. Impression: Insulinoma. Plan: Surgical referral, endocrinology follow-up.
label: endocrinology

text: History: 58-year-old woman presents with progressive difficulty walking, frequent falls, and urinary incontinence. Family notes memory problems. Exam: Wide-based gait, mild cognitive impairment. MRI: Enlarged ventricles. Impression: Normal pressure hydrocephalus. Plan: Neurosurgery referral for shunt evaluation.
label: neurology

text: History: 27-year-old man presents with sudden onset of severe, unilateral, periorbital pain, lacrimation, and nasal congestion. Attacks last 30–60 minutes, occur nightly for 2 weeks. Exam: Ipsilateral ptosis, miosis. Impression: Cluster headache. Plan: High-flow oxygen, sumatriptan, neurology referral.
label: neurology

text: History: 44-year-old woman presents with progressive numbness and tingling in her feet, difficulty walking, and urinary urgency. Exam: Spastic paraparesis, hyperreflexia, decreased vibration sense. MRI: Multiple periventricular white matter lesions. Impression: Multiple sclerosis. Plan: Start disease-modifying therapy, neurology follow-up.
label: neurology

text: History: 68-year-old man presents with gradual, painless loss of vision in his right eye. He has a history of hypertension and diabetes. Exam: Cotton wool spots, microaneurysms, and neovascularization on fundoscopy. Impression: Proliferative diabetic retinopathy. Plan: Ophthalmology referral, optimize glycemic control.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 29-year-old woman presents with acute onset of eye pain, redness, and photophobia in her left eye. Exam: Decreased visual acuity, consensual photophobia, ciliary flush. Impression: Anterior uveitis. Plan: Start topical corticosteroids, urgent ophthalmology consult.
label: ophthalmology

text: History: 54-year-old man presents with sudden, painless loss of vision in his right eye upon waking. Exam: Pale retina with cherry-red spot on fundoscopy. Impression: Central retinal artery occlusion. Plan: Immediate ophthalmology referral, ocular massage, reduce intraocular pressure.
label: ophthalmology
